I am a freelance designer and videographer from New Orleans with a passion for iced coffee, good music, and pixel-perfection.

With a huge amount of motivation and experience, I push the creative and the technical to max. With every project, I believe that practical integration of the two, along with thoughtful content, will produce powerful products with the ability to inform and inspire its consumers. In the end, that is what I produce everything for: human interaction. It does not matter if it is video or audio or design, I always believe a project must perform well, look good, and be practical and easy for consumers to use or digest.

You can connect with me on Dribbble, Behance, Github, and -of course- Twitter.

No. 1 - Design

Designing is my greatest passion. Over the past few years, I have developed a love for the objectified skill of graphic design. I apply this passion toward the web. I believe that the "old age" art of finely tuned grids and good typography can be used on the modern web.

No. 2 -Video

At the the New Orleans Center for Creative Arts (NOCCA) I studied Media Arts for four years, from 2010 to 2014. I will graduate as the old level four student. As a media arts student I recieved industry standard training in film production, inlcuding: screenwriting, cinematography/camera operation, color grading, editing, and all other aspecs of film. As a NOCCA student I have shot eight personal films, worked as a production assistant on local shoots, a camera operator for local TV, and recently the TEDx conference video crew.

No. 3 -Audio

In addition to studing video production at NOCCA, I also study audio engineering: including enginnering and mixing and mastering. In 2012 I reccorded three hours of studio and two hours of live audio. In 2013, I have reccorded nearly two hours of live and one hour of studio.

Design+Video+Audio
Made with in New Orleans
